Author: bitdiddle
Content:
I happened to interview with this company, Eons, a year or so ago. At the time they were looking to do a RoR knockoff of their existing site. I'm not sure where they went with that.

I'm wondering about a few things. The founder I believe was involved with Monster, .ie. has a track record. How do \nstartups with this kind of capital succeed? The money itself is going to attract all sort of folks who won't necessarily add value. Does it come down to just leadership?

How this contrast with the approach of Y Combinator, where S,K, and I with a large dose of youthful energy provide a complete basis :)

Author: phil
Title: New AOL Email Beta Cannot Compete With Google, Yahoo
